course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Engineering Psychology
course.description: Introduction to cognitive engineering and human performance. Perception, psychophysics, attention, time-sharing, workload and their implications on human performance.

reviews.title: READ BOOKS !!!!
reviews.comment_content:
Engineering Psychology:
1.Introduction
2.Scientific Investigation
3.Perception and Psychophysics
4.Signal Detection Theory
5.Vigilance and Information Theory
6.Spatial Perception
7.Memory, Learning, and Training
8. Manual Control
9.Action Selection
10.Attention, Time-Sharing, Workload
11.Stress and Human Error

The content is a little bit too much for one semester, Prof will not cover everything, so you need to read the whole book by yourself out of class, which can take some time.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof is good indeed, but the book seems to be more useful since there is a lot of knowledge in the quiz that prof. will not mention in class or ppt because of the time limitation. So the teaching actually doesn't really matter. You can simply just read the whole book. I called this blended learning which I really do not like.
reviews.comment_grading: Reasonable. I didn't spend time reading books so I have a low grade in quizzes. and result in a low grade. But it is still reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a little bit big. (Probably for all Ravi's class). Basically revision for the quiz (Every class), and the lab report. You need to learn Processing (Java) coding in the first few weeks. Despite the 2 hour lecture. Labs will take around 3 + 2 hours and 2 hours left per week for reading books.
